abstract: Criminal charges against two former traders for JPMorgan Chase intensify scrutiny of the bank’s executives. | Eike Batista has taken further steps to dismantle his business empire. | John A. Paulson has bought the company that makes his favorite pianos. | The reinsurance arm of Third Point is expected to begin trading.
snippet: Criminal charges against two former traders for JPMorgan Chase intensify scrutiny of the bank’s executives. | Eike Batista has taken further steps to dismantle his business empire. | John A. Paulson has bought the company that makes his favorite p...
lead_paragraph: Criminal charges on Wednesday against two former traders for JPMorgan Chase intensified the scrutiny of the bank’s executives in New York, where, federal authorities say, lax controls and the pressure for profits made the problem worse, Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg report in DealBook.
